This privacy policy describes how we collect, use, process, and
protect your personal information when you visit our website and use our
services.

If we
become aware that we have collected personal information from a child under 13
years old without verified parental consent, we will take steps to remove the
information as soon as possible.

If you believe that we may have collected
personal information from a child under 13 years old, please contact us
immediately.

**Information Collection**  
We collect information when you register on our website, place an order,
subscribe to our newsletter, fill out a feedback form, or interact with our
website in any other way.

We may collect the following information:  
  

  * Information provided directly by you during registration (Username, Password, Email Address).
* Information provided directly by you during filling in user profile and using the system (First Name, Last Name, Location, Tour Itineraries, Phone Number).
* Other information you provide to us through your use of our website and services.

**Third-Party Services**  
We use the following third-party services on our website:  
  

  * Facebook API: We use the Facebook API to allow you to log in to our website using your Facebook account.
* Google Analytics: We use Google Analytics to track website traffic and to better understand how our website is being used.

When you make a payment,
you will be redirected to the Stripe website, where you will be asked to
provide your payment information.

**Disclosure of Information to Third Parties**  
We do not sell, trade, or transfer your personal information to third parties
without your consent, except for the information necessary for booking trips.

In such cases, we will only share the minimum amount of personal information
required for the booking process.

**Response to Legal Request**  
We may disclose the information in response to a legal request related to a
judicial proceeding or other legal process.

**Not Identifiable Information**  
We may share anonymized information (with any part of the data that can be
used to identify you removed) with third parties for marketing, advertising,
and research purposes.
